item.title: Angela add a quote by Utah Phillips
item.description: "The state can't give you freedom, and the state can't take it away. You're born with it, like your eyes, like your ears. Freedom is something you assume, then you wait for someone to try to take it away. The degree to which you resist is the degree to which you are free..." -- Utah Phillips

item.title: Angela add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Fiction is the lie through which we tell the truth." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Angela add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "The individual cannot bargain with the State. The State recognizes no coinage but power: and it issues the coins itself." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Angela add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "The end justifies the means. But what if there never is an end? All we have is means." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Angela add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "I think the mystery of art lies in this, that artists’ relationship is essentially with their work — not with power, not with profit, not with themselves, not even with their audience." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Angela add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Art is action. The way I live my life to its highest degree is by writing, the practice of art." -- Ursula K. Le Guin
